James Boyko

Assistant Professor in Ecology and Evolutionary Biology at University of Michigan.

Welcome

Hello! I am James Boyko, a comparative biologist at the University of Michigan.

My research focuses on studying phenotypic evolution on a macroevolutionary scale - typically by applying or developing phylogenetic comparative methods. More recently, Iâ€™ve been interested in applying deep neural networks to understand phenotypic evoluion for high-dimensional and non-standard data types.
